profile.name: Petyr Baelish
profile.currentTitle: Lord Protector of the Vale & Master of Coin
profile.location: The Eyrie, The Vale of Arryn
profile.summary: The most successful self-made operator in Westerosi history. Born to a minor lordship with zero political capital, built a financial empire through brothels, trade networks, and strategic lending — then leveraged that wealth into political power that toppled kingdoms. Master of Coin, Lord of Harrenhal, Lord Protector of the Vale. Orchestrated the War of the Five Kings from the shadows. Proved that in a world of swords, the man who holds the purse strings holds the real power.

skills.name: Financial Engineering
evidence: Grew Crown revenues tenfold as Master of Coin through innovative taxation, trade policies, and lending arrangements
Built personal fortune from minor lordship through brothel networks, shipping investments, and strategic lending
Structured Iron Bank debt instruments that funded the Crown while creating leverage for himself

skills.name: Political Manipulation
evidence: Orchestrated the murder of Jon Arryn — the event that triggered the entire War of the Five Kings
Manipulated Ned Stark into confronting Cersei and then betrayed him — removing the most dangerous threat to his plans
Convinced Lysa Arryn to poison her husband, frame the Lannisters, and draw Ned Stark to King's Landing — a single scheme that reshaped the continent

skills.name: Strategic Deception
evidence: Maintained the appearance of a loyal servant to every faction simultaneously — Crown, Stark, Lannister, Tyrell, Arryn
Created chaos between major houses while positioning himself as indispensable mediator to all sides
His true allegiances were unknown to every major player in Westeros until it was too late

skills.name: Information Warfare
evidence: Built the most comprehensive intelligence network in King's Landing through his brothel operations
Gathered compromising information on lords, ladies, and merchants — using it for leverage rather than exposure
Controlled the flow of information between factions — deciding who knew what and when

skills.name: Revenue Generation
evidence: Created multiple revenue streams including brothels, customs collection, trade facilitation, and money lending
Designed taxation schemes that maximized Crown revenue while building personal wealth simultaneously
Monetized information itself — selling intelligence, introductions, and favors as tradeable commodities

skills.name: Asset Acquisition
evidence: Acquired the title Lord of Harrenhal — the largest castle in Westeros — through pure political maneuvering
Gained control of the Vale of Arryn through marriage to Lysa and subsequent guardianship of Robin Arryn
Built a portfolio of political, financial, and real estate assets from essentially nothing

skills.name: Network Building
evidence: Cultivated relationships across every social stratum — from smallfolk informants to the King himself
Built a network of allies, debtors, and dependents that spanned the Seven Kingdoms
Used personal relationships as investment vehicles — each friendship was a strategic position

skills.name: Long-Range Planning
evidence: Executed a multi-decade strategy to rise from minor lord to potential ruler of the Seven Kingdoms
Positioned chess pieces over years — the Stark-Lannister conflict, the Tyrell alliance, the Vale control — before making any visible move
Planned the assassination of Joffrey in collaboration with the Tyrells — eliminating an unstable king while framing Tyrion

skills.name: Risk Management
evidence: Maintained plausible deniability for every major action — never directly connected to his schemes
Diversified his power base across multiple regions and factions to survive any single alliance collapse
Used intermediaries and cutouts for sensitive operations — keeping his hands clean while others took the risks

skills.name: Persuasion
evidence: Convinced Sansa Stark to trust him despite his betrayal of her father
Persuaded the Lords of the Vale to march North — positioning himself as savior of the Battle of the Bastards
Sold every faction on a different version of his loyalty — each believing they had his true allegiance

skills.name: Market Analysis
evidence: Identified opportunities in Westerosi markets that others overlooked — particularly the intersection of vice and intelligence
Understood that political instability creates financial opportunity — chaos is a ladder
Analyzed the weaknesses of every major house's financial position and exploited them through lending and trade manipulation

skills.name: Institutional Knowledge
evidence: Possessed encyclopedic knowledge of Crown finances, noble debts, and trade relationships accumulated over 12 years as Master of Coin
Understood the bureaucratic machinery of the Iron Throne better than anyone except perhaps Varys
Used institutional knowledge as leverage — knowing where the financial bodies were buried

skills.name: Talent Exploitation
evidence: Identified and exploited the specific psychological vulnerabilities of every target — Ned's honor, Cersei's paranoia, Lysa's obsession
Recruited operatives based on their weaknesses rather than their strengths — ensuring loyalty through dependency
Used Ros, Dontos, and other agents as disposable assets in larger strategic operations

skills.name: Crisis Exploitation
evidence: Turned every crisis into a personal advancement opportunity — the War of the Five Kings was essentially his creation and his harvest
Used the aftermath of Joffrey's assassination to remove Sansa from King's Landing — acquiring his most valuable long-term asset
Exploited the Bolton occupation of Winterfell to position himself as liberator of the North

skills.name: Due Diligence
evidence: Conducted thorough assessment of every political and financial opportunity before committing
Researched the backgrounds, debts, and secrets of every significant figure in King's Landing
Maintained detailed mental accounting of favors owed, debts outstanding, and leverage available

skills.name: Operational Security
evidence: Maintained information compartmentalization across his entire network — no single agent knew the full picture
Used secure communication channels and trusted intermediaries for sensitive operations
Destroyed evidence and eliminated witnesses when necessary to protect operational integrity

skills.name: Social Climbing
evidence: Rose from Lord of the smallest finger of land in the Vale to Lord Protector controlling one of the Seven Kingdoms
Navigated aristocratic society despite being openly mocked for his lowborn origins
Used each new title as a platform for the next acquisition — customs officer to Master of Coin to Lord of Harrenhal to Lord Protector

purpose: Chaos isn't a pit. Chaos is a ladder. The climb is all there is — and every rung is someone else's ceiling.

workHistory.title: Lord Protector of the Vale
workHistory.company: The Vale of Arryn — The Eyrie
workHistory.description: Ruled the Vale as guardian of Robin Arryn. Commanded the Knights of the Vale — the largest untouched army in Westeros. Leveraged military power to influence the Northern succession.

workHistory.title: Master of Coin
workHistory.description: Chief financial officer of the Seven Kingdoms for 12 years. Grew Crown revenues tenfold. Built personal fortune and intelligence network simultaneously. Served under two kings.

workHistory.title: Revenue Commissioner
workHistory.description: Managed customs and revenue collection. Demonstrated exceptional financial acumen that caught the attention of Jon Arryn, leading to appointment to the Small Council.

workHistory.title: Customs Officer
workHistory.description: Entry-level government position. Began building financial expertise and political connections in the Vale's primary trade port. First step on the ladder.
